instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.SMC_BATLOW_L: What is SMC_BATLOW_L? SMC_BATLOW_L refers to a power management signal that indicates a low battery condition. The "_L" suffix suggests that this is an active-low signal, meaning that it becomes low when the battery reaches a low voltage threshold..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: Hi guys, got this one in, working. Customer wanted to upgrade, checked the board and area around <TRANSISTOR>Q5060</TRANSISTOR> was corroded. Told him it needs fixing but he said he needed it at night, so came back the next day, mac died. Luckily not in my hands :). Anyway, I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5060</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5059</TRANSISTOR> and resistors around it. Also replaced <CAPACITOR>C4907</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R5250</RESISTOR> beside SMC. Then I replaced <RESISTOR>R6101</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6100</CAPACITOR> that looked corroded. For the rest all looks pretty OK. Now i have green and orange light with battery plugged in, but missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, I do have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>. PPBus sits at 12.6v and I have 3.42v as well. Also there is a short in <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, I see its also going to the area i replaced IC, but all resistor I changed measure OK. Should i first focus on the 5V, or are these related?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
If you detect a pure short to ground, no need to power up the board.
Locate the culprit and solve that problem first.
Start with lower voltage if choose to inject tension.
You can remove <TRANSISTOR>Q7830</TRANSISTOR> and test if board starts at least.
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> pulses?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: My flir cam saved the day on the short, <CHIP>U5501</CHIP> was shorting 3v3 its back to normal after replacement. However, board not starts yet, now i am missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>. I do have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> & S4 and 12.59v going into <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>. Since there is 3.3v coming out of <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> can i assume the IC is good, or can only half of it work? <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> does not pulse when connecting the charger. On <TRANSISTOR>Q7911</TRANSISTOR> I have 0v on pin 2 and 3.44 on pin 3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> is controlled by <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check if it pulses at least.
Is not easy to see the pulse just connecting charger.

<CHIP>U7200</CHIP> should be good, it has 5V rail blocked.
5V should come up, if you remove <RESISTOR>R7913</RESISTOR>, just for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: If i remove <RESISTOR>R7913</RESISTOR> i do get 5V yes. I get no response on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>. Means CPU is dead? Maybe because i removed the <CHIP>U5510</CHIP> some leg under the cpu are screwed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
Here some other values:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.44v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> = 3.27
Also tried it with battery connected and original 60 watt charger. Do have green and orange light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
Does it start in SMC bypass mode?
Check all 4 RTC signals, page 16.
Also check 32KHz presence at pin 12/<CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.
